page.title: 01FLAT LAND OF THE LITTLE OUSE
page.content: The two dozen homes that line the banks of the Little Ouse are mostly farm houses, the only access to these being a poplar lined dirt track which stretches the length of the village. Little Ouse is surrounded by farmland many of the fields are also lined by tall poplar trees which stand as windbreakers against the 'Fen Blows' - strong winds which rob the fields of valuable top soil. Farming is the most common occupation here with the flat land being used to grow sugar beet, potatoes and cereal crops, thoses who so not work on the land commute 10-30 miles to the nearest town or city. For the children in the village there is a one roomed primary school. However this will close in 1986 and all the children will travel to either the primary school in Littleport of the college in Ely 10 miles away.
